sn36.12:4.1: “Mendicants, various winds blow in the sky.
sn36.12:4.2: Winds blow from the east, the west, the north, and the south. There are winds that are dusty and dustless, cool and warm, weak and strong.
sn36.12:4.3: In the same way, various feelings arise in this body: pleasant, painful, and neutral feelings.”
